root: ^The steady clang of hammer on steel draws you to the town Smithy.
^"Ho there Smithy!" you cry. The hammering stops.

b: ^"Ah there you are!" Says the Blacksmith. "I have something for you." He hands you a heavy iron key. "This is a key to the Church cellar, I thought you might be able to make use of it."

smithy: ^"Ah the young witch. Come to try your luck once more?"

c: ^," you say "I hope to find her soon."

smithy_1: ^"And what do you want from me?"
^"You can help me prove my innocence."
arguments: ^"When did you last see your daughter?"
^"Will you hear my side of the story?"
smithy_1_1: ^"The night before she vanished," he says "with you."
^"Well it's your word against the Priest then, and he is a man of God."
smithy_1_2: ^"He has never given me cause to misbelieve him." says the Smith.
^You think for a moment. "Doesn't he inist that children will always be safe in God's grace?"
^"Aye, he does...but witches are the work of the Devil."
smith_1_22: ^"My point is, if you daughter is Godly, shouldn't she be safe despite the Devil?" The Blacksmith considers this. "You have given me much to think on..."
smithy_1_3: ^"Go on," he says. It seems like he is getting impatient.
^"I have been framed. Someone wants you to think I am a witch."

c: ^, wouldn't they want to be hide?"
^"That's not a proper argument." He returns to his forge muttering, "Bloody witches"

smithy_2: ^"That is all I ask." You say.
^"I will at that," says the Smith "I never thought much of that Priest..."

b: ^He thinks a moment, then hands you a heavy iron key. "This is a key to the Church cellar, I think you may be able to make use of it."
